How to Install odt2txt on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • odt2txt

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install odt2txt on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing odt2txt on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall odt2txt in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install odt2txt, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install odt2txt Using apt

To install odt2txt in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install odt2txt using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install odt2txt

The installation of odt2txt might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install odt2txt Using apt-get

To install odt2txt using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install odt2txt.

sudo apt-get -y install odt2txt

Install odt2txt Using Synaptic

To install odt2txt using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install odt2txt on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for odt2txt. This will display the odt2txt package in the package window, now to install odt2txt, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the odt2txt package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of odt2txt.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install odt2txt Using aptitude

To install odt2txt on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of odt2txt.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install odt2txt using the command aptitude install odt2txt.

sudo aptitude -y install odt2txt

How to Upgrade odt2txt on debian

If you want to upgrade the odt2txt package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade odt2txt using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade odt2txt to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade odt2txt.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade odt2txt sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade odt2txt

Upgrade odt2txt using Aptitude

To upgrade odt2txt using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade odt2txt.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade odt2txt

Upgrade odt2txt using Synaptic

To upgrade odt2txt using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for odt2txt, now right-click odt2txt, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade odt2txt just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall odt2txt on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall odt2txt from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just odt2txt, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove odt2txt

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of odt2txt

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of odt2txt you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge odt2txt

Remove odt2txt using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall odt2txt using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for odt2txt, right-click the odt2txt package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall odt2txt click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install odt2txt on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade odt2txt using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of odt2txt then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
